channel.title: My RSPS Concept
channel.description:
Seeing as I quit the RSPS scene altogether I'll post my "masterpiece" idea I've always had. This can be a community project and eventually released or whatever. If enough people actually want to work on it and such. I've just really always wanted to see it completed.
First off this was concepted for a 317 server. When you reach 200,000,000 experience in a skill you would be given the opportunity at your will to teleport to the RuneScape's God's Temple and receive a God Cape of Accomplishment in said skill. You get to decide which god you receive it from, but it doesn't matter. Each god is sitting in a throne. With these capes comes a new set of emotes and effects. Effects affect your gameplay whether you are wearing the cape or not.
Attack: Emote: Does two roundhouse kicks in succession and then jumps in the air. Your character seems to float there as he does multiple superman punches. Then he lands on his feet and it is over. Each kick/punch would have flames around them almost like they are breaking the sound barrier. Effect: Never ever hits a 0 with melee attacks.
Strength: Emote: Pick up a huge boulder and throws it/picks up the world and carries it on his back. Effect: 10% chance of hitting double your max hit.
Defence: Emote: Arrow flies at the character and the character simply catches it with both of his hands like praying and tosses it aside. A magic fireball is blasted at the character and he brushes it aside. A boulder is hurled and the character and he crosses his arms in front of his face and the boulder smashes to dust on impact. Effect: 25% chance of reducing a hit by half
Ranged: Emote: Shoots an arrow high up into the sky and as it comes down he shoots another arrow and break the arrow descending in half. Effect: Never hit a 0 with ranged weapons.
Magic: Emote: Shoots an air blast similar to air surge, then causes a mini wave to come from the side, then causes a huge pillar of Earth to rise from the ground, then a wall of fire surrounds the player. Effect: Half of runes are required for spells.
Prayer: Emote: Character clasps his hands together and bows his head, and a aura seems to envelop the character. A sword is swung at the player but is recoiled by the aura. Three arrows are shot at the player, but the aura acts as a shield and they clatter to the ground. A magic fireball is casted at the player and it seems to envelop the player, but the player is left unscathed because the aura acted as a shield. The player unclasps his hands and looks up. The aura seems to dissipate and a shadowy figure is seen above him, watching over him. Effects:1/2 of prayer points consumed while praying.
(I'm going to skip a few skills and put blanks later as typing on a small iPod with big fingers is annoying. I'll only put the ones down I have emotes for now.)
Agility: Emote: Does a barrellroll and then does two back flips in one jump. Effect: unlimited running
Slayer: Emote: Tussels with a dark beast barehandedly, finally grabs it by the heand and slams it into the ground. Then the player places one foot on the dark beast like a captain Morgan pose. Effect: Requires no slayer equipment and slayer monster effects are useless.
That's all of the skills I thought up while concepting this idea. Hopefully this will inspire one of you to finish what I never accomplished.

item.title: My RSPS Concept
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Lazyness:

Thing is… How do you do something such as make a custom emote?

Have you been living under a rock? RSPoser has been out for years now

Read full topic

item.title: My RSPS Concept
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

RsPoser silly.

Read full topic

item.title: My RSPS Concept
item.dc:creator: @Lazyness Lazyness
item.description:
@Lazyness wrote:

The Wanderer:

We should make it as a showoff to other communities showing off what our members are capable of. I’ve always wanted to make custom quests but I was never sure of how the memberbase would react to custom quests as they already hate customs because of the shitty recolors n such.

Thing is… How do you do something such as make a custom emote?

Read full topic

item.title: My RSPS Concept
item.dc:creator: @Lazyness Lazyness
item.description:
@Lazyness wrote:

Genius. Simply brilliant. GREAT ideas! Want to see it happen soon cause these would be SICK in a server.

Read full topic

item.title: My RSPS Concept
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“man_killerx, post:14, topic:389867”]This topic is being revived, Due to wanderer’s tut he is about to make. It is time that we change how private servers work. I have seen progress in the modeling community, Next step is to help you guys on your topology. This will be needed for animation.[/quote]Agreed. Plus, I’ve been dying to make some kind of quest with its own items, animations, and new special attacks and such. I think if we pull something like this off, it’ll be amazingly epic.

Read full topic

item.title: My RSPS Concept
item.dc:creator: @man_killerx man_killerx
item.description:
@man_killerx wrote:

This topic is being revived, Due to wanderer’s tut he is about to make. It is time that we change how private servers work. I have seen progress in the modeling community, Next step is to help you guys on your topology. This will be needed for animation.

Read full topic

item.title: My RSPS Concept
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

The Wanderer:

It would just take you a long time to create all of them. Not necessarily hard, but time consuming, yes.

A lot of modeling is purely time consuming. We look at something, and then the main thing they did was spend time. Given enough time, anything is possible

Read full topic

item.title: My RSPS Concept
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

badger41:

love the concepts. But do we have the tools that are good enough to bring them to light? Dunno if RSPoser could do something like that, you might want to ask Dust R I P as hes pretty good with poser.

I looked into it and the only problem you might have is having too many frames. MrP explained how could split them up, but I couldn’t really understand what he was saying as it had a lot to do with coding haha. I’m pretty sure rsposer can handle all of this, just you would have to know what you are doing to get the desired result.

Read full topic
